1 choice scenario //2nd Choice Directory? 2 choice scenario //character state 1 //background state 1 //Type of Scenario Dialog //dag dag lang pag may time //Scenario Prompt Scenario Promt //Choices 1st Choice //1st Choice Directory? 1 choice scenario //character state 1 //background state 1 //Type of Scenario Dialog //dag dag lang pag may time ////////////Start//////////////////////// Mc: Looks like biology class is about to start.\n Teacher: Good Morning class, for today the topic would be the Animal and Plant Next second_scene 1 1 Dialog Loud Screams on the outside Tell the teacher they should check out the screams ignore fourth_1 third_scene 2 1 Dialog *You hear the Screams becoming Louder and Louder, Car Crashes Have Been heard really strong* Tell the teacher they should check out the screams ignore fourth_1 third_scene 1 1 Dialog Teacher: (name of Mc) sit back down its some acidents going on down the streets and pay attention in class next fourth_2 1 1 Dialog A rushing person comes in the Science Lab screaming \n Person: RUN the school is in danger(might change this line sounds eh) next fourth_3 1 1 Dialog you and your teacher starts panicing and runs out of the laboratory \n You Run in the middle of the school only to find out a huge infestation has been starting next fourth_4 1 1 Dialog Mc: I need to find a place to hide into or atleast be able to survive till help comes Gym Locker Room Kitchen Storage Room first_scene first_scene fifth second_scene 1 1 Dialog Choose your weapon Rocket Launcer Key Plasma ball Martin Pangit first_scene key key key 1 1 Item Try to open Gate? Yes No rest first_scene 1 1 Dialog Gate 1 Use key? Return won first_scene 1 1 fourth_4 Restricted You won Return first_scene 1 1 Dialog ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////MENU TEXT//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Return Return to Start Toggle Sound Reset Game Are you sure? Yes No ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////ERROR CATCH//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Oh no! You\'re not supposed to be here. I supposed you should go back to the start > Return to Start gameOver 1 background1 Dialog You wake up, finding yourself in the middle of a forest. The trees are thick and the sky is dark, you feel
as if something is wrong.

Your body is cramped and you find it hard to move

Regardless, you stand up, and your eyes are drawn to the path ahead of you. > Continue a2 1 introduction Dialog ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////START GAME//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// You wake up, finding yourself in the middle of a forest. The trees are thick and the sky is dark. You feel like you\'ve been here before

A familiar fatigue strikes your entire body. Suddenly, flashes of events you are yet, or already have, experienced rush through your mind.

It seems you\'ve returned back in time. The uneasiness you felt after killing the curses linger still. Perhaps a different choice will answer your questions.

Determined, you stand up, eyes drawn to the path ahead of you once more. > Continue a2 1 introduction Dialog You wake up, finding yourself in the middle of the forest. The trees are thick and the sky is dark.
You\'ve been here countless times now.

Your memories are clear, and though the curse is strong, a long forgotten duty must be fulfilled.

Determined, you stand up, eyes drawn to the path ahead of you once more. > Continue a2 1 introduction Dialog You walk. The atmosphere around is eerily silent. You start wonder why your head feels so heavy and why you are in a forest.

The silence is interrupted by a voice in the distance. It seems to be calling out to you. > Continue a3 1 introduction Dialog You move towards the voice, and you start to see a figure in the distance.

"Oh thank heavens a survivor! Quickly, there is no time to waste! I will explain on the way."

A young woman dressed in elegant robes appear before you and quickly grabs your arm. With no strength to resist, you are dragged away. > Continue a4 1 introduction Dialog "You are tired and confused so I will keep this simple. I am a Guardian, sworn to protect this sacred forest."

The woman introduces herself as she pulls you towards an intersection in the distance.

"Not too long ago this forest has been consumed by an evil curse. You are one of its dwellers; this forest is your home" > Continue a5 1 introduction Dialog In the wave of her hand, the sword and shield float towards you.

"These weapons will help you in your endeavor, and also heal you. Choose one and be on your way." > Sword > Shield > Unarmed > Sword and Shield b1 c1 d1 e1 1 introduction Item ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////SWORD PATH//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// You pick up the sword.

"This sword will cut through steel and magic, but it will not hold in face of strong spells. Be careful with your defense."

"Are you sure you will use this?" > Yes > No b2 a5 1 introduction Dialog "Very well, I wish you the best of luck on your journey. The fate of this forest rests in your hands."

You feel the sword\'s magic flow through your body. You are healed and your senses have come back to normal.

You feel as if there something amiss with the Guardian, likely because of the curse.

Without dwelling on it, you head towards… > The Witch of the North > Knight of the East > The Dragon of the West > The Priest of the South b2a1 b2b1 b2c1 b2d1 1 introduction Dialog You arrive at the north of the forest, where a curse lays. Beyond rests the ruins of a small village, nestled deep within the thick trees. At the edge is the remains of what seemed to be a church.

You enter its dusty doors, and across the large hall sits a witch on her wicked throne.
You approach slowly, and she stands and looks down on you. > Continue b2a2 1 witch_church Dialog You arrive at the east of the forest, where a curse lays. As you enter you are met with a vast plain of flowers. Though the sight is beautiful, you know that the pale white color of the petals is a sign that the flower has been removed of its life force

In the distance, you see a figure huddled underneath a tree in the middle of the area.
It seems to be…laughing? > Continue b2b2 1 knight_field Dialog You arrive at the west of the forest, where a curse lays. The area is warm and mountainous, where snow and ice are found, instead you find fire and lava popping from the ground.

You hear a booming roar, and in the distance, a colossal figure rises from the horizon. Its head then moves towards your direction, and it begins to fly. > Continue b2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog You arrive at the south of the forest, where a curse lays. Before you is a wet and damp swamp, with the effects of the curse changing the color of the water to an eerie purple.

In front of you is an enclosure, where a beast-man priest with a lion\'s head stands in the middle. His eyes are pale, and lifeless. He notices your presence, and braces himself. > Continue b2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog //////////////////B2A1////////////////// "Intruder, it is safe to assume you are here to kill me?"

She raises her hand, and spears of light appear behind her. Her eyes glow as she readies the spell, but they do not hide the clear sorrow and regret inside.

"Do what you must, but know that this is not by my will." > Raise your sword and dash [Attack] > Raise your sword and block [Defend] > "What is this place?" > "Not by your will?" b2a2a1 b2a2b1 b2a2c1 b2a2d1 1 witch_church Dialog She fires the spears at your direction. With fluid movement, you dodge every spear and approach the witch.

You get in range, and slash, but she blocks it with a barrier.

"Your weapon may be strong, but it is not enough against my magic." > Continue b2a2a2 1 witch_church Dialog She locks your sword in the barrier, before long it begins to glow.

She notices this and throws it away, leaving you helpless against her attacks.

As you draw your final breath and all turns black, you see a small tear being shed for you

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 witch_church Dialog She fires the spears at your direction. With precise technique, you slash at every spear that approach you.

With every spear blocked, you start to feel your sword beginning to burn brightly. The witch falters at the sight of the glowing blade

"No…not again!" > Continue b2a2b2 1 witch_church Dialog She summons more spears, but before she can fire them, you move in for the kill, but she blocks it with a barrier.

"My magic is strong! I won\'t lose against you!"

With her trembling voice, she begins to chant a spell, but her barrier begins to crack as the bright sword pressures her magic. > Continue b2a2b3 1 witch_church Dialog "How ignorant, you are inside the church of the sacred forest. Pay your respects." > Return b2a2 1 witch_church Dialog "I follow only the will of the…forest?…but I…no! I must not falter." > Return b2a2 1 witch_church Dialog She notices the cracks, and fumbles her spell, shocking her due to recoil. This causes the barrier to break, and your sword to deal her a fatal blow.

The witch staggers and falls to the ground. She sobs as life leaves her eyes.

"I couldn\'t protect everyone…"

You have defeated a curse, allowing the Guardian to eliminate the other curses, reclaiming the sacred forest.

Though you feel something is amiss, all is well.

-E N D- > Remember a1_1 1 good_ending Ending //////////////////B2B1////////////////// You inch closer, and as you arrive you see a man with long white hair curled up on his knees, with two swords stabbed on the ground beside him. You can hear him giggling slightly.

"Heehee…heeeheeee…there isss an intruder today....how about we go and...play?"

In an instant, he grabs his two swords and lunges towards you. Fortunately you manage to block, and behind his unkempt hair you see his maniacal, bloodshot eyes.

"HAHAHAHA!! I LIKE YOUR SWORD, LETS SEE IF IT BREAKS!!" > Fight back and match his energy [Attack] > Block and wait for an opening [Defend] > "Did you break the flowers too?" > "You\'re crazy!" b2b2a1 b2b2b1 b2b2c1 b2b2d1 1 knight_field Dialog You steel yourself and push him away.

"HAHAHAHA!! THAT\'S RIGHT!! LET\'S PLAY UNTIL WE DROP!!!"

You begin exchanging blows, swords clashing against each other, its song echoing across the plains as sparks begin to fly.

The maniac is relentless with his offense, but you are no different. His harrowing laugh is contagious, as you begin to enjoy the battle as well.

Eventually, the maniac backs off for a moment to catch his breath. Seeing this opening, you go in for the kill. > Continue b2b2a2 1 knight_field Dialog You steel yourself and push him away.

"HAHAHAHA!! THAT\'S RIGHT!! LET\'S PLAY UNTIL WE DROP!!!"

He begins to slash away at you, but you manage to be patient and block his relentless attacks. The maniac grows restless, as with every block and parry his attacks grow faster.

"WHY…ARENT…YOU…FIGHTING?!!" > Continue b2b2b2 1 knight_field Dialog He screams. You keep blocking and playing defense, you are yet to find an opening, and attacks are getting faster with every second. But eventually, he pauses and backs off for a breath.

You go in for the kill, but as you swing your sword, the cracks begin to show, and it shatters to pieces.

You look up towards the maniac, and the last thing you saw was his smile and your reflection on his blade.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 knight_field Dialog "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA" > Return b2b2 1 knight_field Dialog "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA" > Return b2b2 1 knight_field Dialog "Heh…heheheh…that was fun… I hope we get to play again."

He mutters as you remove your sword from his chest. The maniac drops his swords and fall to the ground.

You have defeated a curse, allowing the Guardian to eliminate the other curses, reclaiming the sacred forest.

Though you feel something is amiss, all is well.

-E N D- > Remember a1_1 1 good_ending Ending //////////////////B2C1////////////////// In no time, the dragon lands in front of you. Its shadow covering you and the mountains behind. It looks down at you with its glowing, fiery eyes.

"YOU REEK OF A STENCH I AM NOT FOND OF, INTRUDER. LEAVE OR PERISH."

It\'s booming voice rings in your ear. Its scales begin to glow, and y ou sense it will begin to attack you soon. > Attack first [Attack] > Stand on Guard [Defend] > "Are you the one causing this fire?" > "Hide behind a rock" b2c2a1 b2c2b1 b2c2c1 b2c2d1 1 dragon_lair Dialog The dragon opens it mouth. You know for a fact that a dragon\'s scale cannot be penetrated easily, and so you jump towards the inside of its mouth and hack away at its tongue.

But the moment you enter, the dragon stops at its tracks and laughs.

"HAHAHA! YOU ARE MORE FOOLISH THAN I THOUGHT."

And at that moment, the dragon breaths

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 dragon_lair Dialog You ready your sword as the dragon opens its mouth. You would think that the sword would be able to cut a dragon\'s breath in half.

But unfortunately, reality isn\'t always in your favor, as a dragon\'s breath is too wide to cut in half for your size.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 1 Dialog "FOOL. I AM THE KING OF THESE SNOWY PEAKS. I BREATH TO EXTINGUISH THESE FLAMES…BUT WHY DO THE FLAMES GROW STRONGER?" > Return b2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog You attempt to hide behind a big rock nearby, but the dragon notices this and blasts it to smithereens.

"YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM ME, INTRUDER." > Return b2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog //////////////////B2D1////////////////// "An intruder! Please leave me alone, I didn\'t mean to harm!"

The beast-man exclaims. Despite his pleas for mercy, you know he is still a curse. He grips his staff tightly, waiting for you to make a move. > Lunge in for the attack [Attack] > Stand on guard [Defend] > "You are a beast-man, why are you afraid?" > "You must pay for your crimes" b2d2a1 b2d2b1 b2d2c1 b2d2d1 1 priest_swamp Dialog Throwing away your doubts, you lunge in towards the priest. He yelps, and begins to throws out a barrage of spells at you.

While moving towards him, you hack away at the never ending projectiles coming from his staff. But your efforts are in vain as your arms begin to give out, and you are slowly swallowed by his magic.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 priest_swamp Dialog Listening to his cries, you lower your sword and attempt to approach him. But unfortunately, this made him even more paranoid, as you look very intimidating while holding a weapon.

Raising his staff, he shoots a fast laser spell aimed towards your forehead before you could do anything, and all turned dark.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 priest_swamp Dialog "I wish to live, intruder. Pride means nothing in the face of death" > Return b2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog "I didn\'t mean to hurt anyone! I wasn\'t..ngh.....I...no.."

The priest shakes his head. He seems to be hurting.

"I am a priest, why do I hurt?" > Return b2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////SHIELD PATH//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// You pick up the shield.

"This shield will defend you from the strongest of spells, but will not provide you with a strong offense"

"Are you sure you will use this?" > Yes > No c2 a5 1 introduction Dialog "Very well, I wish you the best of luck on your journey. The fate of this forest rests in your hands."

You feel the shield\'s magic flow through your body. You are healed and your senses have come back to normal.

You feel as if there something amiss with the Guardian, likely because of the curse.

Without dwelling on it, you head towards… > The Witch of the North > Knight of the East > The Dragon of the West > The Priest of the South c2a1 c2b1 c2c1 c2d1 1 introduction Dialog You arrive at the north of the forest, where a curse lays. Beyond rests the ruins of a small village, nestled deep within the thick trees. At the edge is the remains of what seemed to be a church.

You enter its dusty doors, and across the large hall sits a witch on her wicked throne.
You approach slowly, and she stands and looks down on you. > Continue c2a2 1 witch_church Dialog You arrive at the east of the forest, where a curse lays. As you enter you are met with a vast plain of flowers. Though the sight is beautiful, you know that the pale white color of the petals is a sign that the flower has been removed of its life force

In the distance, you see a figure huddled underneath a tree in the middle of the area.
It seems to be…laughing? > Continue c2b2 1 knight_field Dialog You arrive at the west of the forest, where a curse lays. The area is warm and mountainous, where snow and ice are found, instead you find fire and lava popping from the ground.

You hear a booming roar, and in the distance, a colossal figure rises from the horizon. Its head then moves towards your direction, and it begins to fly. > Continue c2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog You arrive at the south of the forest, where a curse lays. Before you is a wet and damp swamp, with the effects of the curse changing the color of the water to an eerie purple.

In front of you is an enclosure, where a beast-man priest with a lion\'s head stands in the middle. His eyes are pale, and lifeless. He notices your presence, and braces himself. > Continue c2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog //////////////////C2A1////////////////// "Intruder, it is safe to assume you are here to kill me?"

She raises her hand, and spears of light appear behind her. Her eyes glow as she readies the spell, but they do not hide the clear sorrow and regret inside.

"Do what you must, but know that this is not by my will." > Raise your shield and dash [Attack] > Raise your shield and block [Defend] > "What is this place?" > "Not by your will?" c2a2a1 c2a2b1 c2a2c1 c2a2d1 1 witch_church Dialog She fires the spears at your direction. With steady movement, you block every spear and approach the witch.

You get in range, and bash, but she blocks it with a barrier.

"Your weapon may be strong, but it is not enough against my magic."
> Continue c2a2a2 1 witch_church Dialog She locks your shield in the barrier, before long it begins to glow and absorb the barrier\'s magic.

She notices this and throws it away, leaving you helpless against her attacks.

As you draw your final breath and all turns black, you see a small tear being shed for you

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 witch_church Dialog She fires the spears at your direction. With patient and steady form, you block a spear that was shot at you

The witch falters at the sight of the glowing shield

"Absorption?…not again!"

The witch summons more spears, you hold on once more. She fires a spear above you, and you manage to block it, but another spear was fired at your side, hitting you in the arm and removing the shield.

"I won\'t lose again."

With her trembling voice, she summons her remaining spears, and fires.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 witch_church Dialog "How ignorant, you are inside the church of the sacred forest. Pay your respects." > Return c2a2 1 witch_church Dialog "I follow only the will of the…forest?…but I…no! I must not falter." > Return c2a2 1 witch_church Dialog //////////////////C2B1////////////////// You inch closer, and as you arrive you see a man with long white hair curled up on his knees, with two swords stabbed on the ground beside him. You can hear him giggling slightly.

"Heehee…heeeheeee…there isss an intruder today....how about we go and...play?"

In an instant, he grabs his two swords and lunges towards you. Fortunately you manage to block, and behind his unkempt hair you see his maniacal, bloodshot eyes.

"HAHAHAHA!! A SHIELD?!! COWARD!, LETS SEE IF IT BREAKS!!" > Fight back and match his energy [Attack] > Block and wait for an opening [Defend] > "Did you break the flowers too?" > "You\'re crazy!" c2b2a1 c2b2b1 c2b2c1 c2b2d1 1 knight_field Dialog You steel yourself and push him away.

"HAHAHAHA!! THAT\'S RIGHT!! LET\'S PLAY UNTIL WE DROP!!!"

You attempt to fight back, exchanging blows and your weapons clashing against each other, but your shield does nothing against him, unlike his swords against you.

The maniac is relentless with his offense, and eventually he breaks your guard and deals a fatal blow.

As your head falls to the ground, the last thing you hear is a bone-chilling laugh echoing throughout the plains

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 knight_field Dialog You steel yourself and push him away.

"HAHAHAHA!! THAT\'S RIGHT!! LET\'S PLAY UNTIL WE DROP!!!"

He begins to slash away at you, but you manage to be patient and block his relentless attacks. The maniac grows restless, as with every block his attacks grow faster.

"COWARD!!! FIGHT!!!!"

He screams. You keep blocking and playing defense, you are yet to find an opening, and attacks are getting faster with every second. But eventually, he pauses and backs off for a breath.

You go in for the kill, but you can only do so much with a shield. The maniac parries your attack with one sword and stabs you with the other

You look up towards the maniac, and the last thing you saw was his smile and your reflection in his eyes.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 knight_field Dialog "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA" > Return c2b2 1 knight_field Dialog "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA" > Return c2b2 1 knight_field Dialog //////////////////C2C1////////////////// In no time, the dragon lands in front of you. Its shadow covering you and the mountains behind. It looks down at you with its glowing, fiery eyes.

"YOU REEK OF A STENCH I AM NOT FOND OF, INTRUDER. LEAVE OR PERISH."

It\'s booming voice rings in your ear. Its scales begin to glow, and y ou sense it will begin to attack you soon. > Attack first [Attack] > Stand on Guard [Defend] > "Are you the one causing this fire?" > "Hide behind a rock" c2c2a1 c2c2b1 c2c2c1 c2c2d1 1 dragon_lair Dialog The dragon opens it mouth. You know for a fact that a dragon can choke on its own breath, and so you jump towards the inside of its mouth in attempt to block the breath from leaving the mouth.

But the moment you enter, the dragon stops at its tracks and laughs.

"HAHAHA! YOU ARE MORE FOOLISH THAN I THOUGHT."

And at that moment, the dragon closes its mouth.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 dragon_lair Dialog You ready your shield as the dragon opens its mouth. The ground rumbles in response to it charging its breath.

The moment its head lunges, you raise your shield and block the breath. It is scorching, but nevertheless you persevere and hold on.

This goes on for a while, as the dragon\'s supply of breath seems endless. But your patience is rewarded as the dragon\'s breath weakens and stops. > Continue c2c2b2 1 dragon_lair Dialog "FOOL. I AM THE KING OF THESE SNOWY PEAKS. I BREATH TO EXTINGUISH THESE FLAMES…BUT WHY DO THE FLAMES GROW STRONGER?" > Return c2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog You attempt to hide behind a big rock nearby, but the dragon notices this and blasts it to smithereens.

"YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM ME, INTRUDER." > Return c2c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog The dragon pants and takes a breath

"FOUL CREATURE. I WILL CRUSH YOU."

It raises its claw high in the air. In this moment, you take the opportunity to aim your shield towards the dragon\'s head, and release the absorbed magic.

The magic hits its head, and the dragon falls to the earth. In its final breath, it said > Continue c2c2b3 1 dragon_lair Dialog "Your scent…is just like mine…"

You have defeated a curse, allowing the Guardian to eliminate the other curses, reclaiming the sacred forest.

Though you feel something is amiss, all is well.

-E N D- > Remember a1_1 1 good_ending Ending //////////////////C2D1////////////////// "An intruder! Please leave me alone, I didn\'t mean to harm!"

The beast-man exclaims. Despite his pleas for mercy, you know he is still a curse. He grips his staff tightly, waiting for you to make a move. > Go for his staff [Attack] > Stand on guard [Defend] > "You are a beast-man, why are you afraid?" > "You must pay for your crimes" c2d2a1 c2d2b1 c2d2c1 c2d2d1 1 priest_swamp Dialog Throwing away your doubts, you lunge in towards the priest. He yelps, and begins to throws out a barrage of spells at you.

While inching closer, you move your shield in his direction, blocking and absorbing all the projectiles from his staff. This causes the shield to glow and burn brightly

"No…no! Stay away! Get back!"

As you enter point blank range, the projectiles stop. In that moment you grab his staff and throw it away. The priest stumbles and attempts to run away, but you intercept him by releasing the absorbed magic in your shield. > Continue c2d2a2 1 priest_swamp Dialog Listening to his cries, you lower your shield and attempt to approach him. But unfortunately, this made him even more paranoid, as you look very intimidating while holding a weapon.

Raising his staff, he shoots a fast laser spell aimed towards your forehead before you could do anything, and all turned dark.

-GAME OVER- > Remember gameOver 1 priest_swamp Dialog "I wish to live, intruder. Pride means nothing in the face of death" > Return c2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog "I didn\'t mean to hurt anyone! I wasn\'t..ngh.....I...no.."

The priest shakes his head. He seems to be hurting.

"I am a priest, why do I hurt?" > Return c2d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog The projectile hits the priest and he falls to the ground. He turns and looks at you, pleading one final mercy.

"Please....kill...me..."

Your shield burns bright as magic shoots out from its center. > Continue c2d2a3 1 priest_swamp Dialog You have defeated a curse, allowing the Guardian to eliminate the other curses, reclaiming the sacred forest.

Though you feel something is amiss, all is well.

-E N D- > Remember a1_1 1 good_ending Ending ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////UNARMED PATH//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// "Oh? But not wielding a weapon means certain death. We can\'t have that" > Return > I know what I\'m doing a5 d2 1 introduction Locked1 "Your…confidence is frightening. Are you planning something?"

The Guardian inspects you top to bottom.

"That doesn\'t seem right…Very well, As long as the curses are confronted and killed, I will not question your methods"

"Are you sure you will go through with this?" > Yes > No d3 d1 1 introduction Dialog "Then I wish you the best of luck on your journey. The fate of this forest rests in your hands."

The Guardian then heals your fatigue with a spell. She waves goodbye as you head towards the crossroads.

Your memories of your past have begun to clear up, although some parts are still missing. You feel as if something is amiss with the Guardian

Knowing this, you head out to find answers. > The Witch of the North > The Knight of the East > The Dragon of the West > The Priest of the South d3a1 d3b1 d3c1 d3d1 1 introduction Dialog You arrive at the north of the forest, where a curse lays. Beyond rests the ruins of a small village, nestled deep within the thick trees. At the edge is the remains of what seemed to be a church.

You enter its dusty doors, and across the large hall sits a witch on her wicked throne.
You approach slowly, and she stands and looks down on you. > Continue d3a2 1 witch_church Dialog You arrive at the east of the forest, where the knight lays. As you enter you are met with a vast field of flowers. Though the sight is beautiful, you know that the pale white color of the petals is an effect of The Knight\'s presence here.

In the distance, you see The Knight huddled underneath the tree in the middle of the area.
You approach him, and from far away he notices you and turns around. > Continue d3b2 1 knight_field Dialog You arrive at the west of the forest, where the dragon lays. The area is warm and mountainous, where snow and ice are found, instead you find fire and lava popping from the ground.

You hear The Dragon\'s booming roar, and in the distance, a colossal figure rises from the horizon. Its head turns towards your direction, and it begins to fly. > Continue d3c2 1 dragon_lair Dialog You arrive at the south of the forest, where the priest lays. Before you is a wet and damp swamp, with the effects of the curse changing the color of the water to an eerie purple.

In front of you is an enclosure, where the beast-man priest with a lion\'s head stands in the middle. You approach The Priest cautiously, trying to grab his attention without startling him. > Continue d3d2 1 priest_swamp Dialog //////////////////D3A1////////////////// "You… you seem familiar."

The witch paces around the hall, making sure to keep distance from you. She raises her hand and prepares a spell against you.

"You stand before a sacred temple of the forest. Lying is forbidden, and punishment is absolute. Tell me: why are you here?" > I\'ve come for answers d3a3 1 witch_church Dialog She pauses, and after sensing no hostility in your words, she lowers her hand.

"…Speak." > What happened here? > Do you know who I am? > The Guardian… > Did the forest will it so? d3a3a1 d3a3b1 d3a3c1 d3a3d1 1 witch_church Dialog "A tragedy…the people here begun succumbing to the effects of the curse. I watched as everyone slowly lost their minds, they could no longer hear the cries of their forest.

I had to put them down." > Return d3a3 1 witch_church Dialog "I can\'t say I do. You feel like someone I know, though you\'re missing something." > Return d3a3 1 witch_church Dialog She looks away with a somber face.
